title: The Caged Lion

text: attendants through death and desertion on the road; and passing from one
title: The Caged Lion

text: religious house to another, as his strength and nearly exhausted means
title: The Caged Lion

text: served him.  Unable to find any vessel bound for Leith, he had taken ship

text: for London; concealing his quality, lest, in the always probable
title: The Caged Lion

text: contingency of a war, it might lead to his being made prisoner; and thus
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: he had arrived, sick indeed unto death, but peaceful, rejoicing, and
title: The Caged Lion

title: The Caged Lion

text: 'Sister,' he said, 'the morn that I had offered my ring, I was feeble and
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: faint; and when I knelt on before the altar in continued prayer--I know
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: not whether I slept or whether it were a vision, but it was to me as
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: though I were again on the river, and again the hymn of Bernard of
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: Morlaix was sung around and above me, by the voice I never thought to
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: hear again.  I looked up, and behold it was I that was in the boat--my
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: King was there no more.  Nay, he stood on the shore, and his eyes beamed
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: on me; while the ghastly wounds that I once strove in anguish to staunch
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: shone out like a ruby cross on his breast--the hands, that were so sorely
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: gashed, were to me as though marked by the impress of the Sacred Wounds.
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: He spake not; but by his side stood King Henry, beautiful and
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: spirit-like, and smiled on me, and seemed as though he pointed to the
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: wounds, as he said, "Blessed is the king who died by his people's hand,
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: for withstanding his people's sin!  Blessed is every faint image of the
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: true King!"
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: 'Then methought they held out their arms to me; and I would have come to
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: them on their shore of rest, but the river bore me away--and I looked up,
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: to find I was as yet only in the earthly Jerusalem; but I watch for them
title: The Caged Lion
author: Yonge, Charlotte M. (Charlotte Mary)

text: every hour, to call me once and for ever.'
